# List of IRA ambushes of the Irish War of Independence

This is a list of ambushes carried out by the Irish Republican Army against "Crown Forces" during the Irish War of Independence (1919–1921).
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Ambush
! Date
! Target
! IRA strength
! British strength
! IRA losses

| Soloheadbeg ambush
| 21 January 1919
| Royal Irish Constabulary (RIC)
| 10 volunteers
| 2 constables(James McDonnell and Patrick O'Connell)
| None
| McDonnell and O'Connell were both killed
|-

| British Army
| 20 volunteers
| 12–20 soldiers
| 1 wounded
| 3–10 wounded
|-

| 22 September 1920
| RICBritish Army
| 50 volunteers
| 10 lorries of British troops
| 2 wounded
| 6 killed7 wounded

| 22 October 1920
| British Army
| 30 volunteers
| 2 lorries of British troops
| None
| 3 killed4 wounded6 captured
